com.communote.common.menu

Class SubmenuBuilder<T extends MenuEntry>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.common.menu.SubmenuBuilder<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - type of the menu entries of the sub menu

    public class SubmenuBuilder<T extends MenuEntry>
extends Object
    Builder for a sub-menu with entries whose positions are described declaratively by a PositionDescriptor.
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

    • Method Detail

      • addAll

        public void addAll(List<T> entries,
                   PositionDescriptor positionDescriptor)
        Add all of the given entries with the same position descriptor.
        Parameters:
        entries - the entries to add to the sub-menu
        positionDescriptor - descriptor of the position of each entry within the sub-menu

      • addEntry

        public boolean addEntry(T entry,
                        PositionDescriptor positionDescriptor)
        Add an entry to the sub-menu.

        If called several times with position type TOP the entries which were added later will be positioned before those added earlier. If called several times with position type BOTTOM or AFTER (and the same menu entry ID to position after), the entries which were added later will be positioned after those added earlier. Entries with position type TOP are always before the BOTTOM positioned entries. Entries with position type AFTER will not appear in the resulting menu if the referenced menu entry does not exist. However, if that referenced entry is added later on, the entries to position after that entry will than be contained in the sub-menu.

        To get the resulting sub-menu the build method needs to be called.

        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to add
        positionDescriptor - descriptor of the position of the entry within the sub-menu, can be null for default positioning at bottom
        Returns:
        whether the entry was added or there was already an entry with the same ID

      • buildSubmenu

        public List<T> buildSubmenu()
        Build the resulting sub-menu
        Returns:
        ordered list of entries of this sub-menu

      • getEntry

        public T getEntry(String entryId)
        Return an entry by its ID.
        Parameters:
        entryId - the ID of the entry to return
        Returns:
        the entry or null if the entry does not exist

      • removeEntry

        public T removeEntry(String entryId)
        Remove an entry from the sub-menu. After successfully removing an entry the sub-menu has to be rebuild explicitly.
        Parameters:
        entryId - the ID of the entry to remove
        Returns:
        the removed entry if the entry existed, otherwise null

      • removeEntry

        public T removeEntry(T entry)
        Remove an entry from the sub-menu. After successfully removing an entry the sub-menu has to be rebuild explicitly.
        Parameters:
        entry - the entry to remove
        Returns:
        the removed entry if the entry existed, otherwise null
